org.rcsb.mbt.model.util
Class Octree

java.lang.Object
  org.rcsb.mbt.model.util.Octree

public class Octree
extends java.lang.Object

Octree class constructed with recursion in mind. Each child is itself a tree.

Author:
Apostol Gramada

Field Summary
static int countChildren
          A counter for the number of children instantiated in the tree

getBonds

public java.lang.Object[] getBonds(float cutOff)
Return an array of all (potential) covalent bonds. Potential bond is a bond that satisfy the distance criterion (i.e. distance less than cutOff).

getBondsVector

public java.util.Vector getBondsVector(float cutOff)
Return the vector of all (potential) covalent bonds. Potential bond is a bond that satisfy the distance criterion (i.e. distance less than cutOff).

getHBonds

public java.lang.Object[] getHBonds(float cutOff)
Return an array of all (potential) hydrogen bonds. Potential bond is a bond that satisfy the distance criterion (i.e. distance less than cutOff). The indexCutOff criterion is different than the one for covalent bonds to correctly select the hydrogen bonds along the backbone in the definition of secondary structures in the Kabsch-Sander algorithm.

getHBondsVector

public java.util.Vector getHBondsVector(float cutOff)
Return the vector of all (potential) hydrogen bonds. Potential bond is a bond that satisfy the distance criterion (i.e. distance less than cutOff). The indexCutOff criterion is different than the one for covalent bonds to correctly select the hydrogen bonds along the backbone in the definition of secondary structures in the

getHBondInfoVector

public java.util.Vector getHBondInfoVector(double cutOff)
Return the vector of all (potential) hydrogen bonds in a format used by the Kabsch-Sander algorithm implemented by the DerivedInformation class. Potential bond is a bond that satisfy the distance criterion (i.e. distance less than cutOff). The indexCutOff criterion is different than the one for covalent bonds to correctly select the hydrogen bonds along the backbone in the definition of secondary structures in the
